name: *Sarah's NYE Tree Dress & Matching Tie* Custom Order Final Payment
description:
This dress is a reserved custom order for *Miss Sarah*.  Please do not order this item unless this is you. Thanks!

After months of planning and a whole lotta stitching to perfection, this dress and matching tie are complete!  

This tree dress represents a combination of several beautiful aspects of life: Patience, manifestation of goals, friends old and new, and of course, celebration!  

It has been such an honor to have made these two items ~ That I was asked to make something so special... so meaningful....   There are no words.  Thank you so much, Miss Sarah!  I'm so glad we crossed virtual paths.  One day we shall hug in person!

Peace and love and light as we reach a new year!

name: *Festival Dress* ~ The Tutorial PDF
description:
Here it is folks ~ long awaited & available now!

FYI ~ If you order this here, it will be up to 24 hours before I can send it to you.  If you want to be able to download it instantly, it is also available in my Etsy shop at www.pineapplepophandmade.etsy.com

Over the last 10 years, I have been hard at work making hundreds upon hundreds of my patchwork festival dresses.  As the years have passed, I have had dozens of kind folks ask if I could share my patterns.  Unfortunately, I had never written down a single pattern because I based my dresses on a set of measurements and let my creative spirit do the rest.  :-)

I finally sat down and recorded my procedure, step by step, and took pictures and drew diagrams along the way.  Then I stitched it all together into a colorful little package...

And now I am ready to share it with you!

The first tutorial I have ever written ~ and I decided to jump right in and tackle the versatile, yet enigmatic, corset back festival dress!!!

This is the basic pattern behind my lovely hippie patchwork dresses I have made all these years.

This is a digital tutorial in PDF format ~ no hard copy will be shipped.  You will receive your digital file via email.

This is a 'bare bones" tutorial, in that it only includes the basic dress pattern itself ~ patchwork and applique directions are not included.  The short blue "galaxy" print dress (2nd picture) is the exact dress I document making in these instructions.

Why not include instructions for patchwork and applique?

Well, there are just so many options for how to make a dress unique and wonderfully you...  I thought it best to pass on the understanding of how the dress is built and leave it up to you to decide what kind of wonderful personalized bits make your heart sing.

But no worries!  I have included 20 ideas on how to make your dress completely and totally unique!

So, then... What's included?

What you get in this tutorial is thorough 78 pages of step-by-step instructions on the entire process of building your own one-of-a-kind festival dress with over 200 full color pictures and diagrams.  This includes:

Choosing your equipment
Measuring for size
Selecting fabric & other materials
Preparing fabric for sewing
Cutting custom sized pattern pieces
Sewing the dress 
&
Finishing with a professional looking hem

In addition, I added lots of extra tips and background info including:

Complete garment care instructions
Ideas on how to personalize the design
Tips on setting up an online clothing business
Background about me & the festival dress
Dozens of colorful pictures of finished dresses

What kind of equipment will you need to complete one of these dresses?

A sewing machine with a straight stitch and a reverse function
Sharp scissors
Steam iron/ ironing board
Measuring tools
quilting pins
Four thread serger (If you only have a sewing machine, you CAN make this dress, but you will need to have a zig-zag function on your  machine to finish seams so they will not fray.  The finished product will probably not be quite as durable as a serged dress would be, but it will hold up for quite awhile.  It is totally reasonable to try this pattern with a zig-zag stitch to see if a serger would be a good investment for the future.)

I'm also assuming that you have at least a basic understanding of how your sewing equipment works, but if you are a complete and total beginner, this tutorial will give you a good idea of whether or not you want to give it a try.  If nothing else, I think you will enjoy the read and the many, many, many pictures along the way.

This tutorial is a PDF document, which once purchased, will be sent to your email address within 24 hours of purchase, and can be downloaded to your computer and/or printed.  

Happy sewing!!!

name: *Midnight in My Garden* Patchwork Maxi Dress
description:
This stunning dress is made from eleven different 100% cotton floral prints.  Most of them have a black background, a couple have a blue or indigo background, and one has an ivory background, but all of them have bright and bold flowery prints all over.

All of those prints mesh so well together ~ they seem to create a lush fabric garden, with the seams barely visible.

With that said, I'd like to point out that there are two large pockets on the skirt of the dress.  They blend in with the patchwork so well that you can barely see them.

The outer pockets are lined and then double stitched on the bottoms and sides for superior stability.

This would be a good time to mention that all of the exposed seams in this dress are serged with a four thread serger and then top stitched.  This makes for a professional looking finish, and the extra peace of mind of super durable seams.

Up above the empire waist there is the lined bodice, which has a lined pocket stitched to it.  You can keep your goodies safe in there...

Lots of folks ask me if I use darts to shape my bodices.  I do.  We,, sort of...  I figured out a bodice pattern that uses modified princess lines for an even better fit than with darts.  Ah, yes, fabulous curve hugging, bust supporting bodice.  My fave!

The straps go over your shoulders and then lace through four sets of loops like a corset, making for a fitted and adjustable dress.  That along with the elastic at the top of the back of the skirt make for a comfy, comfy dress!

Measurements: 
Bust: 35" - 44" 
Cup Size: A-B-C
Waist: free size 
Hips: free size 
Length (from underarm to hem at side): 47"
Hem Sweep: 101"

Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns for items that do not fit.

name: *Jellyfish in the Sea* Patchwork Maxi Dress
description:
It's funny sometimes ~ I will looks at the same few fabrics over and over again, sometimes for months, and the inspiration suddenly hits me.  I must have had all these fabrics for at least three or four years, and that inspiration happened with this dress.  Right now it seems obvious that this dress was meant to be, but yesterday it wasn't even a thought in my head!

I made if from 8 different cool blue, eggplant, navy and purple 100% cotton print fabrics, stitched together in a long, narrow panel patchwork style.

At the bottom of the front panel there is a satin-stitched jellyfish applique in matching purples and blues.

The bodice is lined, and the pieces are specially shaped and darted to provide the most supportive and comfortable fit you can find.  

The bodice also has a little pocket stitched to the lining of the bodice for all your hidden goodies.

On the right top part of the skirt there is a lined, rounded bottom pocket that is securely double stitched pocket.

There are straps that go over your shoulders and then crisscross lace through four sets of loops for a comfortable, and magically adjustable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 33" - 42" 
Cup Size: B-C-D 
Waist: free size 
Hips: free size 
Length (from underarm to hem at side): 46.5"
Hem Sweep: 83"

Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns for items that don't fit.

Lots of folks ask if I serge my seams.
I do.  In addition, I top stitch all of my seams for a very professional finish.  Comfort and durability are my main priorities!

name: *Memories of Summer Tour* Batik Patchwork Skirt
description:
I originally intended for this skirt to be a short dress, but I ran out of batik fabric before I could get there.  Instead, I modeled it after the other batik skirt I made earlier.

But don't fear!  It is still one of a kind ~ These random patchwork pieces are pretty much impossible to duplicate!

This skirt is so bright and colorful ~ made entirely of the highest quality 100% cotton batik fabrics.  

Each patch and seam is stitched with a four thread serge stitch and top stitching, ensuring the highest quality construction you can find.  

There are two lined, double top stitched patchwork pockets ~ one on each side of the front of the skirt.  

It has a bustle drawstring waist.  That means that the front of the skirt lays flat across your belly, and the drawstring bustles and ties at the back of the waistband for a super comfy and flattering fit.

Measurements:
Waist (make sure this fits over your hips so you can slip it on): up to 44"
Length: 22"
Pockets: 7" x 7"

*Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns for items that do not fit!*

name: Animal Shelter Donation ~ In Loving Memory of Gutter
description:
As many of you already know, I lost my dog ~ my best friend ~ recently.  His name was Gutter and he was my entire world for well over 12 years.  

In his short life, he influenced the hearts and lives of more people and animals than I can count.  

He was the definition of joy and love in a sweet, furry package.

In the spirit of the the light that he brought to the world, I put together this page to donate to companion animal  rescue organizations.

Both Gutter, and his sister, Mona the cat, were both rescues from Last Hope ~ a no-kill animal rescue out of Farmington, MN.  You can find out more info here: www.last-hope.org

Locally, in Nashville, I have chosen to donate to the Nashville Humane Association.  These folks have been angels in finding forever homes for so many furbabies over the years.  You can learn more about them here: www.nashvillehumane.org

If you have an organization that you are particularly attached to, please send me a message through my contact page and I will be sure that the funds reach them.  All I ask is that the organization you choose is a companion animal shelter or rescue of some kind.

If you do not choose your own organization, all proceeds will be evenly split between Last Hope and Nashville Humane Association.  

Shortly after I start collecting, I will be setting up a page on this site listing names of folks that have donated to this cause.  If you would like to remain anonymous, please let me know and I will be sure to keep your donation private.

Pets are a blessing to the Human race ~ and Gutter definitely touched the hearts of everyone he met.   My goal here is to honor his spirit and memory by helping these sweet animals find forever homes, where they have all the love and care they need.

I started the donations here at $1.00 and they go all the way to $100.00.  If none of these options is right for you, please feel free to contact me and I will add the denomination of your choice.

I know times are tough, folks, and truly, even a tiny amount  can make the difference between life and death for dogs and cats.  Please donate ~ for Gutter ~ if it weren't for Last Hope, we would have never found each other.  And I can't even begin to imagine what life would have been like without him.

Thank you all so very much ~ and feel free to contact me if you have any questions at all.

name: *Tranquility* Patchwork Skirt
description:
Here's a pretty little piece that reflects peace and simplicity in design and structure.

This is a simple patchwork skirt with panels of five different pink and cream 100% cotton prints.

My personal favorite part is the pleated ruffle around the hem.  There is a narrow strip of stiffener tucked inside the hem for an exaggerated scallop look.  

The stiffener also helps keep the hem from collapsing, giving the skirt an extra volume boost through many washings.

On the left side is the focal piece of the whole skirt ~ a large lined pocket with the "Aum" applique satin stitched on it.

The pocket closes with a button and a loop.

The skirt has an adjustable waist, with a drawstring that has one decorative wood bead at each end.

Measurements:
Waist (make sure this fits over your hips so you can slip it on): up to 39"
Hips: up to 50"
Length (top of waistband to hem): 18.5

Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns on items that do not fit!

name: *The Inspired* Layer Skirt
description:
This skirt is fabulous ~ In fact, I have been hanging onto it for a couple years, thinking I would wear it myself, but I never have.  Not because I don't love ~ I do ~ but it's just a tiny bit too small for my slowly growing waist!  ;-)

This is a bit of an unusual design for me.  I made the outer layer from a lighter weight sweater knit fabric in a heather purple, with these groovy, abstract flowers in teal, fuschia, black, yellow, and grey all over it.

This layer overlaps itself in the front and has a border of antique white lace for a feminine touch.

On the right side of the skirt there is a large pocket, kinda shaped like a crescent moon, that blends right in with the outer layer fabric.

The under layer is made from a heavenly soft rust colored jersey cotton fabric.  

It has a high-low shape to it, with the front shorter than the back.

This layer features symmetrical ruching and gathers, held together by a thin elastic for ultra comfort.

Both layers are held together at the top by an ultra wide black elastic that gives an amazingly flattering fit around your waist.

Measurements:
Waist: 30"-33" (fits best at or just barely below the natural waist)
Front length: 16" at shortest place
back length: 31" at longest place

Please measure carefully ~ I do not take returns for items that do not fit!

name: *North Woods Lake* Patchwork Maxi Dress
description:
There is kind of a long story to go with this dress ~ I'll post it at the bottom of this page if you are interested.

This dress, I think, is one of my greatest art pieces ever.  It features a large landscape applique at the bottom of the center of the front of the skirt.  I call the applique "The North Woods Lake" after the vast forests of northern Minnesota, near where I grew up.

I am a HUGE fan of wearable art ~ this hippie dress style is so versatile for doing just about anything with decoration.  For this one I went all out and did a very large landscape applique with trees, hills, and a lake...  

The applique captures the spirit of the woodland, and the colors and prints of the patchwork create a unique, one of a kind, three dimensional frame for the forest image.

You may be wondering if I made the applique myself.
I did.  I drew the picture on paper, then transferred it in a 5 step process, by hand, to fabric, and then satin stitched with a sewing machine.  There was no program on the sewing machine for this image.  All I used was a regular satin stitch, thread, and hours upon hours of slow, careful stitching.

Wrapping around the sides and the back of the dress are two panels of Earthy spiral patchwork.  This spiral patchwork is one of the most time consuming styles of patchwork I know how to create.  It is always unique and has a very textured and organic look to it.  In this dress, it represents to freedom that comes from spending time in a place like the great northern woodlands, where there is nothing between you and the pure nature that surrounds you.

You may be wondering, as many of my first time customers do, if I serge my seams. 
I do!  I use a four thread serger for all of the exposed seams, including patchwork, and then top stitch every one of those seams.  It takes about twice as long to stitch this way than to serge only, but it makes for nice, crisp lines and a super durable dress.

The lined bodice is made from a medium brown corduroy that had a dark brown foliage print on it.

Lots of folks ask me if I shape my dress bodices with darts,
I do.  In addition to darts, I specially shape the bodice and its lining to hug curves and provide fabulous support.  There are no squished bust lines here!  

There is also a lined secret pocket on the inside of the bodice.  What's a hippie dress without a secret pocket?

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset, and there is a band of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a comfortable, adjustable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 34" - 43" 
Cup Size: A-B-C 
Waist: up to 40" 
Hips: up to 48" 
Length (from underarm to hem at side): 44"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

*The story behind this dress*

I made this dress at least four years ago.  It is a tribute to the beautiful lakes and evergreen trees that made up the forests in northern Minnesota.  One of the most peaceful places on Earth is in the midst of a scene like this ~ camping next to a remote lake, watching the calm water, hearing a loon's call in the distance...

This dress was originally made for sale, but after I made pictures and put it up for sale for a few days, I decided to keep it.  It is a very rare occasion when I decide to keep my own work...  But I never ended up wearing it.  It has been sitting in my closet since it was made, and it is for too beautiful to only be seen by my walls.  It is my hope that someone comes along and recognizes this scene from sometime in their life and can wear this fabric painting of nature with pride.

I guess the story wasn't that long, but thanks for reading to the end of it anyway!

name: *Coral Ruffle* Infinity Scarf
description:
This is such a unique fabric ~ and it makes for a very unique infinity scarf.  

It is made from a stretch knit in a bright coral color.  It has stripes and ruffles all over it.

I decided to go with a single layer scarf style because a double layer scarf would have just been too bulky with all the ruffles.  

This style of scarf works great for a variety of styles of wear ~ you can wrap it once or twice ~ maybe even three times around your neck, tie it, or even use it as a hair wrap.  It's perfectly made for wrapping around a big pile of dreadlocks in the summer heat.

It measures 8" wide and is 65" in diameter.

name: *Fern Green* Infinity Scarf
description:
This scarf is super soft and heavy enough to keep you warm on cold winter days.

It is double layered and stitched into a huge circle for maximum versatility.

You can wrap it around your neck once, twice, knot it, or even wrap it around your head or hair ~ and works so well with dreadlocks.  

The fabric is a soft, medium weight cotton blend jersey material.  It feels like heaven against your skin!

it measures 11" wide on the double, and is 62" in diameter.

This also perfectly matches my *Full Moon in Pisces* dress, which is pictured but not included.

name: *Battleship Grey* Infinity Scarf
description:
I almost named it "Touch of Gray", but I think I'll save that for later...  hehehe...

This is a lighter weight scarf ~ perfect for those nippy days of fall that are coming up.  The cotton jersey fabric is about the weight and feel of one of those super soft t-shirts that we all love so much.

It is double layered and forms a complete circle *with a twist* that goes wherever you want it. 

This style of scarf is versatile and can be worn in so many ways ~ wrapped once around your neck, twice, tied, or even as a hair wrap.  It's great for holding together a bun of dreadlocks, too!

It measures 9 3/4 inched wide on the double and it is 64" in diameter.

name: *Fade to Black* Infinity Scarf
description:
I love the color of this scarf ~ it's kinda like a faded black, but more of a dark, dark charcoal...  either way you see it, it's gorgeous!

This is a lighter weight scarf ~ perfect for those nippy days of fall that are coming up.  The cotton jersey fabric is about the weight and feel of one of those super soft t-shirts that we all love so much.

It is double layered and forms a complete circle, hence "infinity" scarf.

This style of scarf is versatile and can be worn in so many ways ~ wrapped once around your neck, twice, tied, or even as a hair wrap.  It's great for holding together a bun of dreadlocks, too!

It measures 10" wide on the double and it is 66" in diameter.

* This is a Made-to-order dress.  
Please read carefully before ordering! *

This is a listing for your very own made to order Pineapple Pop full length patchwork maxi dress.  The pictures illustrate what style the dresses are, and some of the color and applique options available.  You are not limited to these designs, by any means ~ the limits are only bordered by your imagination!

The dress style is five to six different colors in 100% cotton printed fabrics.  The skirt has 10-12 panels of coordinating fabrics with a patchwork ruffle around the bottom.  The bodice is specially shaped for support, with straps that go over your shoulders and lace through three or four sets of loops and tighten like a corset.  At the top of the back of the skirt there is a piece of elastic for a snug and comfy fit.  On the inside of the lined bodice there is a pocket for all your goodies.  On the outside of the bodice there is an *applique of your choice*.

Here's what I need to know:

Measurements:
Bust: round the largest part of your bust
Under bust
Above Bust
Bra size
Height
Waist
Hips
Total length: From your underarm to the hem

Color scheme:  
A one or two color scheme works best.
For example: A one color scheme - light blue
Two color scheme: - turquoise and brown

Applique design:
This is where you get to pick something that really represents you.  You could pick your favorite animal, plant, flower, band, religious symbol...  pretty much anything!  Just keep in mind that There is only as much room for your applique as there is space on the bodice, so a representation of the entire Redwood Forest would probably be overkill.  

*Please Be Aware*
 You do pick the colors and the applique, but I do have artistic license to decide what those things mean.  I'm not saying that if you request a daffodil that I will interpret that an a pork chop, but once you say, "I want a black dress with a rose on it", it is up to me to decide what that means.

Once you have made your order here, please email me on the contact page with your measurements, color choice and applique, and then allow up to three weeks for delivery.  I will provide a confirmation email with a tracking number as soon as your dress has shipped.  

If you have any questions, please contact me - Thanks!

description:

name: *Where Would You Like to Go?* Galaxy Sundress - Doctor Who Tardis Cityscape Applique
description:
Once again, it was too dark to take pictures outside, so all I have are these poorly lit ones from inside...  I'll replace them tomorrow :-)

Don't mind the one picture that makes the back look shorter than the front ~ my dress form tilts forward and sometimes makes things look a little "off".  The hem is actually even to the gound all the way around.

This is one heck of a dress!  This is the dress that I documented step-by-step in my Festival Dress tutorial ~ well, just the dress and not the applique was documented.  If you want, you can read how I made it and see the pictures of it being made.  If you have any doubts about the quality after that, I'm pretty sure you may be one of those folks that's impossible to please...  In other words, this dress is built to last. :-)

I acquired this fabric awhile back with the idea that I would make a dress with a cityscape applique on it.   When it was time to make the applique, I drew the picture, cut out all the pieces and attached them to the dress.  Then I kept looking at it and it seemed to scream, "I NEED A TARDIS!"  Then several other kindly folks ~ some without any prompting ~ said, "THIS NEEDS A TARDIS!"  That sealed it!

So, All these little pieces of the buildings and the TARDIS were sitting there, ready to be stitched...  It was BEAUTIFUL!  I just love tedious little appliques! :-)  And this one took MANY hours...  Please don't have too much sticker shock ~ the fabric was not cheap and the applique took literally ALL DAY!

The dress itself is has seams that are serged and then top stitched and the bodice is lined.  The bodice also has a secret pocket on the inside to stash away all your little secrets.  Sssshhhhh!

It has some generously wide straps that go over your shoulders and lace through fours sets of loops like a corset and there is a piece of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for an adjustable and comfortable fit.  That means that not only can it fit several different sizes, but it will also still fit nicely if you lose or gain a couple pounds here and there.

Measurements: 
Bust: 32" - 40" 
Cup Size: A-B-C 
Waist: free size 
Hips: free size 
Length (from underarm to hem at side): 27.5" 
Hem Sweep: 78"

Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns on items that do not fit.

name: *Pretty as a Peach* Patchwork Dress
description:
This is a dress from my old stock ~ it has been sitting here, waiting to find someone to love it for over two years!  It never made it up for sale at any festivals or online, but it is ready to find a home now!

It is made from five different orange, yellow, and peach cotton print fabrics, with just a touch of green for the foliage.

The lined bodice has an applique of one of my famous "framed" flowers, based on the motif printed on the fabric I used for the bodice.

There are two pockets ~ one tucked inside the bodice and one on the front right side of the skirt.  That one has an oblong wooden button to keep it closed.  

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset and there is an elastic band at the top of the back of the skirt for an adjustable, yet snug and comfortable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 35" - 45" 
Cup Size: C-D-DD 
Waist: free size 
Hips:free size 
Length (from underarm to hem): 34"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

name: *A Dance in Plum* Patchwork Dress
description:
This is a design that I am just starting to experiment with...  I used a stunning eggplant, beige, white, off-white, and fuchsia striped cotton print with the lines going vertically for the skirt. 

Around the bottom of the skirt I made a bordered stripe of square patchwork in coordinating colors.  It's not a ton of crazy hippie patchwork, and this subtle stripe really makes the elegance of this dress shine!

The dress drapes beautifully, if not in an unusual way ~ It is longer in the back than in the front, and shorter in the back than on the sides.  It is a fine specimen if whimsical asymmetrical symmetry.

Lots of folks ask if I serge my seams.  I do serge all of my exposed seams with a four thread serger and for an additional punch, I also top stitch every seam.  That makes for a super durable seam with a crisp, professional finish.

The bodice is lined and has a pocket on the inside for your little treasures such as your ID, some cash, maybe even a pretty stone you found while you were wearing it...

Does this dress's bodice have darts?  Yes!  Well, sort of...  I have been using bodice darts for years, but I recently modified my corset back dress pattern.  Now I specially shape three different bodice pieces with something similar to princess seams ~ a style that seems to fit even better than with darts.  It really hugs and supports curves!

There is also an adorable pocket on the top part of the right side of the skirt that is lined with the striped fabric, but the outside is made from a gorgeous vintage lace and it closes with a sweet dark brown oblong wooden button.

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset, and there is an elastic band at the top of the back of the skirt for an adjustable, snug, yet comfortable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 33" - 43" 
Cup Size: B-C-D 
Waist: free size 
Hips:free size 
Length (from top of bodice to hem at front): 36"
Length (from underarm to hem at side): 42"
Length (from top of bodice back to hem at back): 38"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit

name: *All of Time & Space* Crazy Patchwork Bell Skirt
description:
This skirt makes me so very happy...  There are a hundred memories wrapped up in all the patches.  This skirt is totally one-of-a-kind and will never be duplicated.  Even if I wanted to make another one just like this, I couldn't do it!

I made it, for the most part, out of little chunks of leftover patchwork from past projects over the years.  I stitched them into one huge sheet of crazy patchwork and then made this skirt out of that.  It was time-consuming, to say the least ~ it took years to complete!

All the colors of the rainbow are represented in this bell skirt.  It is narrower at the top and then has gussets that create a dramatic flare that starts at the knees.  

The hem has a narrow strip of stiffener that helps maintain its shape, and so the hem won't "collapse" over time.

It has an adjustable drawstring waist and a large, oddly shaped lined pocket on the right side.

Measurements:
Waist/Hips: up to 40.5" (Make sure this fits over your hips so you can pull it on)
Length: 36"

Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns for items that do not fit.

name: *Spring Forest* Crochet Hat
description:
I love these hats ~ they make a statement, keep you warm, and are a nice, soft place to tuck away your hair...

This one is made from several different yarns ~ some natural cotton and wool, and some synthetic.

The colors I chose remind me of being deep in the woods in the springtime ~ woodsy browns, the pale pinks of tiny flowers, and the fresh greens of newborn leaves...

I made this hat in an adult size, and due to the fact that it's crocheted, it has a bit of a stretch to fit several sizes and mops of hair or dreads :-)

These are so fun to make ~ and sometimes I need to take some time away from the sewing machine a do something different for awhile.  Ah, the joy of the crochet hook!

name: *Lady Entomologist* Patchwork Dress
description:
This could have easily been named *Pink Dragonfly* dress, but this dress is too cute for such a bland name.  

I decided on *Lady Entomologist* because science is sexy, and this dress is, too!

It is made from 8 different vibrant pink fabrics with lots of flower prints.  It has just the right amount of bold, bright prints with more mellow, soft ones.  

The skirt is made from panels of each of the fabrics, with a patchwork ruffle around the hem.

The lined bodice is made from a soft salmon colored fabric with little bouquets printed all over it.

Something that's unique about my bodice design:  Lots of customers ask if I make darts in these bodices.  I do something a little different.  I make them with three different fabric pieces that are shaped just perfectly to fit a woman's curves.  It seems to provide more support and definition than darts alone.

On the bodice there is an applique of a dragonfly, which inspired the name of the dress.  An entomologist is a type of zoologist that studies insects, in case you are curious...

There are two pockets on this dress:  One on the right side of the skirt, and one attached to the lining of the bodice - a stash pocket, if you will...

The wide straps lace through four sets of loops like a corset, and there is a piece of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a snug, adjustable fit.

Measurements:
Bust: 33" - 41"
Cup: B-C-D
Waist: Free size
Hips: Free size
Length: 26"
Hem Sweep: 144"

Please measure carefully ~ I cannot take returns on items that do not fit.

name: *Snowflakes & Moonlight* Patchwork Wrap Skirt
description:
This skirt started out as a dress when I was designing it in my head...  It gradually morphed into this fabulous wrap skirt.

I made it from several pretty blue fabrics with one of them covered with a snowflake print.  

There are three tier to this skirt:

The top tier is made from twelve panels of coordinating blue cotton fabrics with bits of white mixed in some of the pieces.

The middle tier is a rail-fence patchwork pattern bordered by a white cotton with a blue floral print.

The bottom tier is made from a ruffle of the snowflake fabric exclusively.

Attached to the waistband is a hip pouch ~ fully lined and securely attached to the waistband ~ with an applique of a crescent moon on it.  The pocket closes with a loop and a large resin button with a snowflake image in it.

These wrap skirts are wonderful because they can fit such a range of sizes and still be well fitted around the waist.

Measurements:
Wrap Waist:  28" - 45"
Length: 37"

name: *Snowflake* Crochet Beanie
description:
Pretty and sparkly ~ this chunky hand-crocheted hat will be sure to blend in with the coming snow while keeping you cozy and warm.

This is made entirely out of a synthetic (wool free) white yarn with little sparkles throughout...

It is made to fit an adult head, and it has a bit of natural stretch to it...

I certainly do love to crochet, but I spend more time on my passion of sewing...  But every once in awhile I get the bug to make a hat or two while I watch trash t.v. at the end of the day ;-)

Enjoy!

And, by the way, the snazzy sunglasses are not included in the price ~ I's sorry!  I know you are just so bummed! ;-)

name: *The Moon in a Sea of Stars* Corset Back Top
description:
When I was making this top, I couldn't decide what the applique could be. Then, late on the night I was working on it, I looked at the sky and decided to use the star fabric I had been stashing away for the perfect project...  and then add a crescent moon to make the night complete.

The lower panel is made from all sorts of pretty blue fabric prints ~ flowers, feathers, snow flakes, geometric and psychedelic patterns.

The lined bodice is made from that special star fabric, and there is a secret pocket in the lining.

On the front of the bodice, there is an applique of the moon in a very cool pale blue/grey/cream print.

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset, making for a snug, adjustable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 32" - 42" 
Cup Size: A-B-C 
Length (from underarm to hem): 22"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

name: *Pale Green Mushroom* Corset Back Top
description:
This top can be qualified as "ultra-cute" ~ It uses most of my favorite green fabrics in my stash, topped off by a luscious green corduroy at the top...

The bottom panel is made from very small random patchwork in all the pretty green 100% cotton fabrics I could find.  

The lined bodice is made from a medium wale Earthy green corduroy, and it has a secret pocket on the inside.

On the front of the bodice there is a mushroom applique made from a pale green paisley cotton fabric.

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset, making for a snug, adjustable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 33" - 43" 
Cup Size: A-B-C-small D
Length (from underarm to hem): 21.5"

name: Celtic Triangle* Seminole Patchwork Dress
description:
This is a very pretty dress!  With Seminole patchwork in vertical stripes down the sides, and coordinating 100% cotton prints throughout, this is a totally unique work of art.

All of the seams are serged and then top stitched for maximum durability and a professionally finished look.  This takes longer than serging alone, but it is worth the time for such high quality.

The lined bodice is made from a pale blue fine wale corduroy, and has the secret pocket on the inside.  What's a hippie dress without a stash pocket?

Lots of folks ask me if the bodices of my dresses have darts.
They do!  Well, sort of...  I used darts for my bodices for years, and I recently developed a new pattern that uses modified princess seams on the bodice only.  That makes for an even better fit than darts.

On the front of the skirt there is an applique of a Celtic knot in the shape of a triangle.

There are wide straps that go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset ~ festival standard for years and years!

There is a band of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a snug, comfortable, and adjustable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 34" - 42" 
Cup Size: B-C-D 
Waist: free size 
Hips:free size 
Length (from underarm to hem): 36.5"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

name: *Picnic in the Park* Patchwork Dress
description:
Here's one from my old stock...  This never made it up for sale when I made it a couple years ago ~ it's just been waiting to be loved for that long!  

It is made from six different red, white and black cotton print fabrics.  Around the hem there is a ruffle of a super psychedelic red and white print that matches the band below the bodice and the straps.

The bodice is lined and has a medallion type decoration that holds together the sweetheart ruffles that shape it.  

Measurements: 
Bust: 30" - 40"

Hips:free size 
Length (from underarm to hem): 31"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

name: *Wildflowers* Patchwork Layer Ruffle Dress
description:
This is another one of the dresses in one of my new dress styles.  It has not only a lined, snug fitted bodice, but the skirt is fully lined with a bit of a ruffle poking out below the outer layer of the skirt.  It also has a little pocket on the inside of the bodice for all of your precious little items.

It is an adjustable size (see ranges below), with straps that lace through three sets of loops on the back like a corset, and a comfortable elastic waistband in the back. It also has a very important feature that you can't see in any of the photos: a little pocket on the inside of the lined bodice.

This is a one-of-a-kind dress that could not be reproduced exactly, even if I tried, so only one luck person will be able to call it their own.

Measurements: 
Bust: 35" - 45" 
Cup Size: C-D-DD

Length (from underarm to hem): 27"

name: *The Infinite Gifts of This Earth* Reversible Patchwork Jacket
description:
Oh, boy ~ I love when a brand new design turns out to be a success!!!  And this one turned out A*M*A*Z*I*N*G!!!!

This is another one of those reversible jackets, but this one closes with corset style lacing.

Yes ~ totally reversible ~ you get two jackets in one!

One side of the jacket is made from an extraordinarily soft Earthy green pinwale corduroy, and the other side is made from patchwork in gorgeous green and blue cotton prints.

On the corduroy side there is an infinity symbol applique on the front of the hood.

There are a total of four lined teardrop shaped pockets ~ two on each side of the jacket.

There is a lined hood with a long point at the back of the hood, which I have seen described as an "elf" or "fairy" hood. I guess it would remind me of a gnome hat if were standing straight up. :-)

The jacket closes in the front like a corset, with four sets of gold grommets and a long cotton batik lace, which makes for an adjustable fit.

Measurements:
Chest: 37" - 48"
Bicep: 15.5"
Sleeve (armpit to cuff): 22" 
Sleeve (shoulder seam to cuff): 26.5" 
Length (center back from seam where hood joins to hem): 33"

*Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final ~ I cannot take returns on items that do not fit.

name: *Deep Charcoal* Infinity Scarf
description:
This is one of those things that I love to wear ~ I have one almost every day as soon as it's cool enough outside.

This infinity scarf is a complete, unending circle, made from a rich charcoal cotton jersey knit.  

This is a heavier weight than a regular t-shirt, so its a great warmer for cold days...

One of the great things about these scarves is that you can wear them in so many ways.  You can knot it, wrap it around your neck once or twice, or even wrap it in your hair.  It is certainly long enough and strong enough to make a durable dread wrap, too!

It measures 9" wide on the double, and it is 60" in diameter. :-)

name: Down Payment - Special Order for Sarah
description: Awesome New Year's Eve dress for Sarah ~ please do not order unless this is you.  Thanks!

name: *Purple Popsicle* Patchwork Dress
description:
This dress is one left from my old stock ~ well, it was actually one of those things that was in my half-finished projects pile.  All it needed was elastic and it was done :-)

I made it from several purple 100% cotton prints.  

It has a lined bodice, but it does NOT have a pocket on the inside.  Instead, it has two pockets on the outside of the skirt.

There are wide straps that go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset.

There is a band of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a snug, comfortable, and adjustable fit.

name: *Cozy Purple Confetti* Crochet Beanie
description:
I'll make this description short and sweet ~ the pics speak for themselves :-)

This warm, fuzzy hat is made from a purple yarn that varies in shade and "fluffiness" throughout...

There are little bits of color that pop up herre and there ~ red, teal, and indigo ~ hence "confetti".

The yarn is mostly merino wool with little bits of rayon mixed in it.

The size is generally made for an adult head, and since it is crocheted, it has a bit of a stretch to it.  Comfy!

*Please note ~ I cannot take returns for my handmade items.  Please choose carefully.

*This price of item does not include the glass head or the sexy plastic sunglasses. :-)

name: *Portrait of a Peacock* Patchwork Dress
description:
Here's another one of my Pineapple Pop "Portrait" applique dresses.  This is one from my stash of old stock.  I have had it made and ready for about two years, but I never got around to offering it for sale ~ until now!  This is a one of a kind piece, so once it's gone, it's gone!

It is made from a handful of turquoise and aqua 100% cotton printed fabrics. 

The lined bodice has a freestyle embroidered peacock in a little frame on the front of it.  "Freestyle" means that I do all the embroidery on the sewing machine without any program.  It's a regular sewing machine, so any embroidery has to be done without a pattern or program.  It's harder, but soooooo rewarding!

The skirt also has a slight hi-low style to it.  That is, it is a bit longer in the front than in the back.  This is one of my favorite additions to these short dresses ~ I feel like it's like putting a mini-train, a formal twist to a casual summer dress.

It has a pocket on the inside of the bodice for all your little goodies, and there is another pocket on the right front part of the skirt, with a little handmade covered button to keep it shut.

The straps go over the shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset.  There is also a band of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a snug, adjustable and comfortable fit.

Measurements: 
Bust: 32" - 40" 
Cup Size: A-B-C 
Waist: free size 
Hips:free size 
Length (from underarm to hem): 28"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

name: *Portrait of a Soulful Flower* Patchwork Dress
description:
This has to be my favorite applique I have done in a long time.  As you have probably noticed, I love to frame flowers and trees in my appliques, and this dress is no exception.

It is made from 100% cotton printed fabric in black and white with a touch of navy blue and red.

The lined bodice has an applique of framed flower that reminds me of a purple cone flower, except for the colors.  Its petals are made from a gray print, and delicately stitched with fine lines of a bold crimson thread.  The center of the flower is red, bordered with black and there is a pale green-gray stem.  

The bodice has a pocket on the inside for all your little goodies and the straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset.

Measurements: 
Bust: 36" - 46" 
Cup Size: C-D-DD 
Waist: free size 
Hips:free size 
Length (from underarm to hem): 27"

Please measure carefully ~ all sales are final and returns will not be taken for items that do not fit.

name: *Rainbow Heart* Patchwork Dress ~ Final Payment~ Reserved for Cathy
description:
This dress is reserved for Cathy ~ Please do not purchase this item unless this is you.  Thanks!

If you would like your own custom Pineapple Pop dress, please write to me via the contact page. :-)

I should also probably let you know, since I have gotten over 10 requests for a dress exactly like this for $50, I can do neither one of those things.

I have been getting several angry replies when I reply to requests saying this so, here's why:

Not one of my dresses can be exactly duplicated
&
Something that takes about 15 hours to make is certainly NOT going to be $50.  The price tag on this listing reflects what is owed.

If you are still interested in a custom order, please contact me ~ Thanks!

name: *Portrait of the Leaves in Autumn* Reversible Wrap Jacket
description:
Oh my goodness ~ this jacket is a lovely representation of how the Autumn trees make me feel. The air becomes cool and crisp and the leaves suddenly change into a warm rainbow of colors and create a safe blanket to keep the soil warm under Winter's snow.  

The title is correct ~ this jacket is reversible. You essentially get two jackets in one.

The pattern I used is one that I made something like eight years ago. It's based off of a sleeveless wrap vest, but I added a hood, sleeves, changed some shapes and dart locations, added a lining and pockets... I guess you could say I made it my own!

One side is made entirely from a soft, varying wale, Autumn sienna corduroy.

The other side is made from patchwork in 100% cotton prints in browns, creams, tans, teals, and sea greens.

The corduroy side has an applique of a large tree with leaves that are in transition from summer to Autumn, preparing to cover the ground.  At the bottom of the trunk of the tree there are three little mushrooms ~ the addition of which was inspired by my autumn walks through woods in the Minnesota River Valley.  It always seemed as if all these mushrooms of different shapes, colors and sizes would pop out of the fallen leaves at this time of the year in those woods.  The applique is "framed" with an oval cotton fabric with a faux patchwork print in a cream, brown, green, rust, and fuchsia floral pattern.

There are four lined pockets ~ two on each side. They are all teardrop shaped and are big enough to keep your hands warm.

There is a lined hood with a long point at the back of the hood, which I have seen described as an "elf" or "fairy" hood. I guess it would remind me of a gnome hat if were standing straight up. :-)

The sleeves bell out as they get closer to the cuffs, with the widest point being at the hem.

The jacket closes with two buttons.  The corduroy side had a round shell button, and the patchwork side has an oblong carved wood button.

name: *Fly Free* Reversible Hooded Vest XS-S
description:
Oh, wow...  I wish I made this to fit me!  I love, love, love it!  Another experiment gone right, I would say!

This is the first hooded vest I have ever made.  It is the same as the jackets I have been making in that it is totally reversible.  You essentially get two vests in one!

One side is made from a blackberry colored wide wale corduroy with stripe accents around the hood and across the pockets.

The other side is made from patchwork in 100% cotton prints in purples, blues, and mauves...

Both sides have their own lined pockets ~ a total of four in all ~ placed on the sides of the vest, in just the right place to tuck in your hands.

On the lower back of the corduroy side there is an applique of a symmetrical butterfly that is framed by a circle of a purple and fuchsia floral printed fabric.

There is a standard shaped hood on this vest.  I thought I'd mix it up a bit and give the pointed hood a rest for a bit ;-)

name: *Soft Blue Sky* Crochet Beanie
description:
This chunky crocheted hat is a cuddly, warm bit of love for your head for those cold winter days...

It is made from several blue yarns in various shades and materials ~ some wool and some synthetic.

Mixed throughout the hat is a super soft "hairy" yarn that adds a whimsical touch of baby pink, yellow, green, and lavender poofs all over the hat.

The hat is made in an adult size, which will fit several head sizes due to the stretchy nature of crochet.

This charming little piece is quite a unique way to stay toasty all winter long :-)

*The price unfortunately does not include the expensive sunglasses that I just KNOW you think you need ~ but they're not for sale.  They're mine, so be jealous ~ become green with envy! Ha ha ha! ;-)

name: *Forever Grateful* Patchwork Maxi Dress
description:
Ah, yes ~ the classic design that I have been making for the last 10 years...  I think I'm going to retire this dress design and make this the last one I make.  Of course I could always change my mind, but I really do think it's time to work on some new ones. :-)

Like I said, this is a classic design that I have been making since the early days of Gutter's Goods.  

When I first decided to make a Grateful Dead dress, I designed a couple that had small, subtle references.  I really didn't feel like those represented how influential the music has been...  I decided to go "over-the-top" and make a proud statement with this dress.  

The dress is made entirely from red and blue 100% cotton prints.  

There are two giant bolt appliques on the skirt ~ one on the front and one on the back.  Each of them reaches from the bottom of the bodice to the top of the ruffle.

Around the hem there is a short ruffle that has a narrow stiffener in the hem.  That helps give the hem body and keeps the skirt from collapsing over time.

The lined bodice had another applique of the classic Steal Your Face motif in the classic red, white, and blue colors.  All of the details are machine stitched.  

On the inside of the bodice there is a secret pocket!!!

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of white loops like a corset.  That and the elastic at the top of the back of the skirt make for a comfortable, snug, and adjustable fit.

Bust: 33" - 44"

name: *Royal Violet* Infinity Scarf
description:
This is one of those things that I love to wear ~ I have one almost every day as soon as it's cool enough outside.

This infinity scarf is a complete, unending circle, made from a royal purple cotton jersey knit.  

This is a heavier weight than a regular t-shirt, so its a great warmer for cold days...

One of the great things about these scarves is that you can wear them in so many ways.  You can knot it, wrap it around your neck once or twice, or even wrap it in your hair.  It is certainly long enough and strong enough to make a durable dread wrap, too!

It measures 11" wide on the double, and it is 64" in diameter. :-)

name: *I've Been There, Man!* Batik Patchwork Skirt
description:
This skirt is so bright and colorful ~ made entirely of the highest quality 100% cotton batik fabrics.  

Each patch ans seam is stitched with a four thread serge stitch and topstiching, ensuring the highest quality construction you can find.  

There are two lined patchwork pockets ~ one on each side of the front of the skirt.  

It has a bustle drawstring waist.  That means that the front of the skirt lays flat across your belly, and the drawstring bustles and ties at the back of the waistband for a super comfy and flattering fit.

This. Is. Too. Cute.

I am so totally in love with these short dresses ~ and it seems like I love each new one better than the last.  This one is no exception!

I made it from six different high quality 100% cotton prints in Bright greens, blues and yellows.  

The skirt forms this gorgeous ruffle at the bottom, which will maintain its shape really well because I included a very narrow strip of stiffener in the hem.

The lined bodice has a secret pocket on the inside and there is a *brand new* applique design of a fish on the front.  

There are extra wide stripes that go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset.  Along with that there is elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a snug, adjustable, and super comfortable fit.

description:
This tree dress encompasses all those feelings that hearing an old folk story can conjure up...  The antique colors and prints in the cotton fabrics, to the ancient tree, outgrowing it's oval frame.

The front of the skirt, the ruffle, and the outer shell of the bodice are made from a unique copper, chestnut, and cream plaid cotton fabric.

The bottom of the front of the skirt has a pretty applique of a mature tree in an old-fashioned oval frame.

The hem is made from a ruffle of the plaid fabric and the bottom of the hem has a narrow strip of stiffener so the ruffle maintains shape over time.

The rest of the skirt is made from several panels of coordinating cotton prints that grow dramatically in width as you reach the ruffle hem.

The bodice if fitted and has a secret pocket on the inside.

The straps go over the shoulders a lace through four sets of loops like a corset and there is a band of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a snug and adjustable fit.

The skirt is made from random patchwork in as many bold, bright prints as I could find ~ there are lots of flowers, butterflies, trees, and various geometric shapes in all colors.

name: *All the Colors of the 'Bow* Patchwork Pants
description:
Patches, colors, comfort, pockets, adjustable length ~ these pants have it all!

Please forgive the pictures ~ I didn't have a human model, so the fit in the pictures is a little off.  They look so much better in person! Also, The pant leg lengths are identical, even though the mannequin makes them appear uneven.

These wide leg pants are made from some sort of magical plethora of patches ~ all arranged in typical "rainbow' order, starting with red at the bottom and violet at the top.

On the back, near the hem of each leg, there is a chunk of spiral patchwork.  This style of patching looks amazing, but it takes forever to make... :-)

There are pockets all over the place.  The back has lined patch pockets with red spiral patchwork, matching the spirals at the bottoms of the legs.  The front/side pockets are "jeans" style, with a watch pocket set in the right side.  There is also a secret pocket on the inside right thigh, which closes with Velcro.

The patch and "jeans" pockets have a little extra durability with the tiny flower rivets where the seams meet.  It's the little things, right?

On the bottom half of each leg there are drawstrings in casings which can be either gathered and tied or left to hang for full length. This makes these pants pretty much perfect for every kind of weather.  And, if you are at a show and need to visit the port-a-jon ~ God forbid ~ you can gather these babies up and walk in and out with confident clean. ;-)

The adjustable waistband is made from purple hand-dyed 100% hemp fabric, and the drawstring is made from a cotton rainbow print material.

name: *Lotus in Violet* Reversible Wrap Jacket
description:
This jacket could not have turned out any better!

The title is correct ~ this jacket is reversible. You essentially get two jackets in one.

The pattern I used is one that I made something like eight years ago. It's based off of a sleeveless wrap vest, but I added a hood, sleeves, changed some shapes and dart locations, added a lining and pockets... I guess you could say I made it my own!

This jacket is a bit longer than the ones I made in the past ~ and it flares out at the bottom for a comfortable fit around your hips.

One side is made from a fine wale, vibrant purple corduroy with stripes of a lilac corduroy on the sleeves and the hood.

The other side is made from patchwork in 100% cotton purple prints.

The corduroy side has an applique of a detailed lotus mandala that I drew years ago ~ back in the days of Gutter's Goods.  I just love the design so much, and I reserve it for my favorite projects. :-) 

 The mandala is totally drawn freehand.  It is, in my eyes, the best kind of art ~ perfectly imperfect.  

There are four lined pockets ~ two on each side. They are all teardrop shaped and are big enough to keep your hands warm.

There is a lined hood with a long point at the back of the hood, which I have seen described as an "elf" or "fairy" hood. I guess it would remind me of a gnome hat if were standing straight up. :-)

The sleeves bell out as they get closer to the cuffs, with the widest point being at the hem.

The jacket closes with two handmade fabric covered buttons ~ one on the inside and one on the outside, respectively.  You will not find any buttons quite like these!

Measurements: 
The measurements are based on where the buttons are placed ~ if need be, I can move the buttons out a couple inches to make the jacket larger.  Please let me know if you would like me to do that.  I can make the Chest fit up to 46".

name: *Famous Feathers* Reversible Wrap Jacket
description:
Labor. Of. Love.

This STUNNING jacket is a totally one-of-a-kind piece of wearable art.  It took countless hours to put together, but on the fourth straight day of creation, it was finally finished.

The title is correct ~ this jacket is reversible.  You essentially get two jackets in one.  

The pattern I used is one that I made, gosh, something like eight years ago.  It's based off of a sleeveless wrap vest, but I added a hood, sleeves, changed some shapes and dart locations, added a lining and pockets...  I guess you could say I made it my own!

One side is made from a pinwale stretch corduroy in a beautiful shade of sepia.  The other side is made from some wild patchwork in teals, aquas, greens, and creams ~ basically the colors of a peacock feather.

The solid corduroy side has an intensely time consuming applique of two peacock feathers stitched on it.  

I was very careful to add what I call "imperfect detail" to the applique.  This was inspired by the real peacock feather I have.  I noticed that a part of the beauty of the feather is its asymmetry ~ bent barbs, a twisted quill...  I tried to reflect those anomalies with the stitching of the feather images.

There are four lined pockets ~ two on each side.  They are all teardrop shaped and are big enough to keep your hands warm.

There is a lined hood with a long point at the back of the hood, which I have seen described as an "elf" or "fairy" hood.  I guess it would remind me of a gnome hat if were standing straight up.  :-)

The sleeves bell out as they get closer to the cuffs, with the widest point being at the hem.

The jacket closes with two handmade fabric covered buttons ~ one on the inside and one on the outside, respectively.

I'm sure I saw something like it somewhere years ago and I thought it was beautiful, so I put my own spin on it. name: *The Indian Elephant* Patchwork Maxi Dress
description:
Ooooooohhh, I think this dress may be found in the dictionary listed under *Perfection*!

It is so tempting to keep this one for myself, but I can't keep them all, can I?  So, I offer this one for sale to one lucky lady!  This is the only dress of its kind, and I couldn't make another exactly like it, even if I tried.

It is made from three extremely high quality 100% cotton designer prints, two 100% cotton designer batik fabrics, a hand dyed 100% cotton pale sky blue fabric, and a lightweight, high quality linen/rayon blend in a *perfectly matching* off-white color.

There is a strip of Seminole patchwork in the middle of the skirt with alternating cotton prints and the hand-dyed blue material.  

On the right side of the skirt there is a large patch pocket that closes with a handmade covered button.

This lined bodice is made from a teal cotton fabric with a print that reminds me of a Greek Key pattern.  On the front there is a meticulously stitched applique of an Indian elephant.  Thank you for the applique suggestion, Heather!

On the inside of the bodice is a secret pocket.

The straps go over your shoulders and lace through four sets of loops like a corset, and there is a band of elastic at the top of the back of the skirt for a comfy, snug, and adjustable fit.
